result.execSummary:
The defendant Amanda Lauranne Hurd was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Amanda Lauranne Hurd is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Amanda Lauranne Hurd was found guilty of Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: HUBER Granted. Report clean and sober. May transfer to Fond du Lac County.
Submit DNA sample and pay surcharge.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt: Marquette County DNA Proof of Submission

Defendant Amanda Lauranne Hurd in court with attorney Mark Jay Gumz.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty Hendee moves to amend Ct. 3 to remove the enhancer and states plea agreement to that amended Ct.3.  Counts 1 & 2 to be dismissed.
Atty Gumz agrees.  
BY THE COURT:  Ct. 3 will be amended to remove the enhancer.

Defendant agrees and enters a No Contest plea.
  Court questions defendant regarding plea. Advises of Constitutional Rights and elements of the charge.  Court finds plea made knowingly, voluntarily & Intelligently.  Court relies on the criminal complaint for a factual basis.  

BY THE COURT:  Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charges.  Court accepts defendant's plea and finds defendant guilty of the amended Ct. 3.  Counts 1 & 2 to be dismissed.

Atty Gumz makes sentencing arguments. Atty Gumz asks to transfer to Fond du Lac County.

BY THE COURT:  Amended Ct. 3:  Court orders 10 days in the Marquette County Jail w/huber
  Report on or before January 2, 2017 by 7:00pm, clean & sober.
May transfer to Fond du Lac County
Court Costs = $243.00
  DNA Sample + $200.00 Surcharge
Defendant agrees to $15 Payment Plan fee.
Payment Plan:  $50.00 per month commencing on December 1, 2016
Credit = 3 days

Counts 1 & 2 to be dismissed.
Plea hearing on November 2, 2016 at 11:30 am.
Atty Mark Gumz
Discovery Demand

Final pre-trial on October 7, 2016 at 08:30 am.
Jury trial on November 10, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Amanda Lauranne Hurd in court with attorney Mark Jay Gumz.  Defendant Amanda Lauranne Hurd in custody.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty Gumz asks the court to proceed with a Not Guilty plea and set for Trial.

BY THE COURT:  Not Guilty plea already entered.  Set for Trial.
bond continued.  Jury trial scheduled for November 10, 2016 at 08:30 am.  Final pre-trial scheduled for October 7, 2016 at 08:30 am.
Signed by BNB/7-18-16

Defendant received a copy of the criminal complaint.  Court advises defendant of right to an attorney.  BY THE COURT:  Court finds probable cause to continue the prosecution of this case and enters a Not Guilty plea on behalf of the defendant. 
  BY THE COURT:  Court sets for Return date on 7/20/16 at 1:30pm.

Defendant Amanda Lauranne Hurd by video.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Court verifies address of defendant and changes the spelling of the street name to Eurika.
Atty Hendee requests signature bond with conditions.  Defendant makes statement.
BY THE COURT:  Court sets $500 signature bond with conditions.
